image.altText: A man crouches on a hospital floor looking at people under silver blankets

items.synopsis: In Gaza's busiest hospital, doctors do what they can to treat a tidal wave of desperate patients injured in Israeli air strikes. WARNING: Some readers might find the details and images in this story distressing.

title.children: Sewing needles, dishwashing liquid and kids on the floor: The unthinkable horrors of Gaza's hospitals

image.altText: Two officials speak with a man.

items.synopsis: A first group of civilian evacuees from Gaza — including 20 Australians — cross into Egypt under a Qatari-mediated deal.

title.children: DFAT confirms Australians among first evacuees to leave Gaza as humanitarian crisis deepens

image.altText: A man dressed as Santa wearing a face mask.

items.synopsis: The Director of Communicable Diseases at NSW Health has warned a COVID wave could peak at Christmas for the third year in a row.

title.children: Another 'COVID Christmas' on the cards thanks to fresh wave, experts warn

image.altText: Smoke plumes behind houses and bushland

items.synopsis: Exhausted crews across Queensland and New South Wales have faced another gruelling night as more than 120 bushfires continued to burn across the eastern states.

title.children: More than 120 bushfires continue to burn in Queensland and NSW and fire crews say they're exhausted

image.altText: a darkened tree line dotted with fire rages before a firefighter facing the blaze

items.synopsis: After varroa mite ruined his first hives and bushfire wrecked his second, NSW Mid North Coast beekeeper Glenn Locke has vowed he will 'get going again'.

title.children: Beekeeper who lost hives to varroa mite and bushfire 'overwhelmed' by support from community

image.altText: A man in a lab coat standing in a white room next to a small bar fridge, making a thumbs down gesture

items.synopsis: Consumer advocacy group CHOICE calls out "the very worst products and services" it found this year.

title.children: This fridge 'doesn't make things cold'. It's won a Shonky Award, just like Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: A composite image of an Aboriginal woman wearing a black hat and a white woman with brown hair

items.synopsis: Cancer survival rates in Australia are some of the highest in the world, but many people, including Indigenous Australians and those living in regional areas, are falling far behind.

title.children: Elise and Jacinta both survived cancer, but the stats show their outcomes could have been very different

image.altText: A woman in a dark top, standing outside in a garden, holding papers

items.synopsis: The central bank insists housing is still a topic of intense focus, as rents and prices rocket, despite a key analysis group within the RBA not meeting for more than a year.

title.children: Despite rocketing rents and property prices, a key Reserve Bank housing analysis group hasn't met for a year

image.altText: A female footballer wearing gold, running away in celebration, smiling, after scoring

items.synopsis: Sam Kerr and Mary Fowler steal the show as the Matildas stamp their class over a determined Chinese Taipei side.

title.children: Fowler and Kerr lead Matildas to victory over Chinese Taipei

image.altText: African American boy lies in hospital bed with four individuals crowded around him with thumbs up

items.synopsis: An Australian teenager on a scholarship in Winston-Salem keeps a student who collapsed on a basketball alive, resuscitating him three times in row until medical help arrives.

title.children: Australian teen's CPR knowledge saves fellow student's life during US exchange program

image.altText: Clint and Michele Jennings

items.synopsis: As multiple blazes threaten Tenterfield region and beyond, farmer firefighters, neighbours and councillors have rallied together to support each other.

title.children: 'Scariest thing we ever experienced': Multiple fire fronts converge in border town as homes confirmed lost

image.altText: Greyhounds racing.

items.synopsis: A greyhound trainer accused of fixing a race says he didn't give one of his dogs actual "liqueur", as police phone taps appear to show.

title.children: 'I chickened out': Greyhound trainer denies dosing race favourite with alcohol

image.altText: Matt Barker and Grace Tame watch another man speak at a press conference

items.synopsis: The term "landmark case" gets bandied around a lot, but the importance of GLJ v The Trustees of the Diocese of Lismore to survivors of institutional child sexual abuse cannot be overstated, writes Louise Milligan.

title.children: A landmark case opens the door for thousands of sexual abuse survivors — and lawyers are already firing off letters

image.altText: A male cricketer in a green and gold shirt, green helmet, in the follow through of a swing

items.synopsis: Glenn Maxwell is under concussion protocols for up to eight days after his second freak accident in the past year.

title.children: Maxwell to miss World Cup clash with England after falling from golf cart

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe, dressed in a suit and tie, arrives at Downing Centre Local court

items.synopsis: Andrew O'Keefe faced a Sydney court today facing several charges including common assault, resisting a police officer and contravening an AVO.

title.children: Videos played in court show Andrew O'Keefe screaming and cursing at police during arrest

image.altText: A man in a white button-up shirt walking with a tree and building behind him.

items.synopsis: Kerrod James Frahm had a "duty of care to protect his son" before the 11-year-old died of a brown snake bite in 2021, magistrate says.

title.children: Court rules father 'had knowledge of alleged snakebite' before his son died

image.altText: a herd of horses in waters

items.synopsis: A local MP whose electorate includes Kosciuszko National Park defends a recent NSW government decision to allow aerial shooting of feral horses, during a budget estimates hearing.

title.children: 'On an excursion, maybe?': Concerns children will see dead brumbies once Kosciuszko aerial cull begins

image.altText: A sign on a sandy stone brick wall, which reads Berri Courthouse. Next to the wall, the sky is blue and cloudy.

items.synopsis: Police in South Australia allege that between 2015 and 2022, Robert Wayne Collins was acting in a position of trust when he was paid the money by several people.

title.children: Man, 81, accused of stealing more than $900K intended for investments, loan

image.altText: Sign for St Lucy's School for children with disabilities in Wahroonga, Sydney.

items.synopsis: A recovery operation is continuing after the 10-year-old boy died at the scene on Cleveland Street in Wahroonga.

title.children: Boy dies after being trapped under a school lift on Sydney's upper North Shore

image.altText: Group photo of Kimberley Indigenous stockmen

items.synopsis: The WA government has reached agreement with claimants acting for thousands of Aboriginal Australians across the state paid little or no wages.

title.children: WA government reaches $180 million settlement in Aboriginal stolen wages class action

image.altText: Ian Smith (1)

items.synopsis: For years, sperm donors believed their identity would remain secret, but the explosion of online DNA databases changed everything, writes Ian Smith.

title.children: My seven biological kids via sperm donation were never meant to know me — but everything's changed

image.altText: A bottle of wine next to a full glass of red wine.

items.synopsis: A recent health survey has reignited the push for health warnings to be introduced on alcohol packaging, but boutique wine producers say their products aren't the problem when it comes to problem drinking.

title.children: Alcohol health warnings for bottles has some winemakers worried

image.altText: Seen from behind, a young person with singlet and hair tied in bun sits on a bed in slightly dark room facing a large window.

items.synopsis: One in three 18 to 19-year-olds in Australia has experienced intimate partner violence in the last 12 months. These young people's experiences show what might help.

title.children: Many Australian teens experience abuse from their partner. But few recognise it as domestic violence

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair at a specialised gym for people with multiple sclerosis.

items.synopsis: As a person with multiple sclerosis, Meg knows "moving is the thing that keeps you going". In her home state, where rates for the disease are the highest in Australia, a new centre has opened to help her and others do that and more.

title.children: With MS, doing nothing is not an option for Meg — she has to keep moving

image.altText: landscape showing missile streak

items.synopsis: The junta has launched a second day of air strikes against rebel groups in Kachin state as it also battles an alliance of ethnic rebel groups in neighbouring Shan state.

title.children: Fighting near Myanmar's border with China leaves thousands displaced

image.altText: Two men shake hands with red china and blue green Solomon Islands flags in the background.

items.synopsis: China's small police liaison team in Solomon Islands will increase to help provide security for this month's Pacific Games, while the Royal Solomon Islands Police Force gets another donation of equipment from Beijing including metal detectors and drones in a move that's causing concern in Canberra.

title.children: 'Progressively displacing Australia': China beefs up police presence in Solomon Islands for Pacific Games

image.altText: A water tank with a black ladder propped against it

items.synopsis: South Australian police say forensic testing has confirmed suspicions that human remains found in the state's Mid North earlier this year are those of suspected murder victim Robert Atkins.

title.children: Human remains found in well in rural SA belong to suspected murder victim, police confirm

image.altText: A Taiwan national flag flutters near the Taipei 101 building at the National Dr Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hall in Taipei

items.synopsis: The self-governing island says 37 Chinese aircraft crossed the median line in the Taiwan Strait, which China no longer recognises as an informal divider between the sides.

title.children: Taiwan accuses China of sending 43 planes, seven ships near self-governing island

image.altText: A ferry next to a sunken boat

items.synopsis: A ferry crashes into and sinks a private boat in the middle of the Brisbane River.

title.children: Investigation launched after Brisbane ferry service crashes and sinks stationary boat

image.altText: A woman and two children stand in front of a large red, metal sculpture.

items.synopsis: Batemans Bay's Sculpture for Clyde will offer an acquisitive prize at next year's event to rival Sculpture by the Sea and the Archibald.

title.children: Art trail's 'big kahuna' $100,000 sculpture prize to rival Sculpture by the Sea

image.altText: Chanel Contos runs her fingers through her hair on stage a National Press Club.

items.synopsis: Across Australia, 58 women have allegedly been killed by men this year — sparking urgent calls for a national family violence register of offenders.

title.children: 'Stop with the trauma bait': Chanel Contos slams media for domestic violence portrayal

image.altText: An older man in a white T-shirt smiles while typing on a computer.

items.synopsis: Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin have been on a tear higher in recent weeks, although they're still well down on record highs. Why are they rising and can it be sustained?

title.children: Retiree Mark lost out after buying Bitcoin near the peak. Now he's excited by its recent rebound

image.altText: Hard of hearing, expert on cochlear

items.synopsis: More than 120 families whose children were caught up in the cochlear implant bungle at Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital have sought payments from the South Australian government.

title.children: Dozens seek compensation over major cochlear implant bungle at children's hospital

image.altText: aerial shot of green boot-shaped island surrounded by blue water and coral reef with white beaches and beachfront cottages.

items.synopsis: From a former party island with a makeshift golf course to quiet, private oases, there are currently five islands for sale, with asking prices starting at $1.75 million.

title.children: Dream of living on a private island? Peek inside the market for millionaires off Queensland's coast
